title: Kamala Harris struggles to emerge from under Joe Biden's cumbersome shadow
summary: The Democratic candidate in the November 5 presidential election has run a lightning-fast campaign, without managing to distinguish herself from Biden, and without praising the record of the president she has served for the past four years.

title: War in Ukraine: In the Donbas region, the Russian army inches forward
summary: Although limited to small villages, the Russian progress in eastern Ukraine weighs heavily on the population's morale, who anxiously awaits the American presidential election on November 5. The outcome could change the course of the war.

title: 'Incalculable' economic losses in the wake of Spain's floods
summary: With roads, railroads, infrastructure and business areas buried by the disaster that struck Spain's Valencia region, emergency funds have been released. But the total cost is expected to be staggering.

title: Ikea, which employed Stasi prisoners before the fall of the Berlin Wall, to compensate GDR victims
summary: In 2012, an investigation revealed that imprisoned political dissidents were exploited in the factories of several East German suppliers of the famous furniture manufacturer. The company has now agreed to pay €6 million in compensation.

title: Zverev beats former champion Rune to set up Paris Masters final against Humbert
summary: Alexander Zverev will play the Paris Masters final for the second time beating former champion Holger Rune, while Frenchman Ugo Humbert, who downed 2018 champion Karen Khachanov, is reaching his first Masters final at the age of 26.

title: In Kenya, car wash, a symbol of wealth
summary: Car washes are spreading in the capital Nairobi, reflecting the middle class growth and the private transport apps boom.

title: In India, a second life for saris
summary: In the suburbs of Mumbai, I Was A Sari has been employing hundreds of underprivileged women for the past 10 years, making new, contemporary pieces for an international audience from used fabrics.

title: Anielle Franco, Brazil's minister for racial equality: 'Without my sister's death, I wouldn't be here today'
summary: A popular jury on Thursday sentenced the two killers of activist Marielle Franco, murdered on May 14, 2018, to 78 and 59 years in prison. Six years after her death, her youngest sister is continuing her fight for greater justice.

title: Kemi Badenoch, a right-wing politician with no time for 'wokism,' is the new leader of the British Conservatives
summary: Representing the right wing of the party, accustomed to controversial comments, the 44-year-old is tasked with turning around a party weakened by its historic defeat in the July elections.

title: Spain sends 10,000 more troops to flood-hit region, as death toll soars to 213
summary: Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said in a televised address on Saturday that the disaster was the second deadliest flood in Europe this century and announced a huge increase in the security forces for relief works.

title: Flooding in Spain: Engulfed in mud, shock and agony, the town of Chiva unites in show of solidarity
summary: In Chiva, one of the worst-affected towns of the flooding in Valencia that claimed at least 200 lives, a year's worth of rain fell on Tuesday, causing unimaginable damage. The search for survivors is proving difficult, but an impressive show of solidarity is taking shape as residents prepare for the aftermath.

title: COP16 biodiversity ends without agreement on funding roadmap to rescue nature
summary: Negotiations were suspended on Saturday morning after negotiations overran and some delegates had to leave to catch flights.

title: The French culture minister, a cathedral and its holy hams
summary: Rachida Dati must decide if hams will still be allowed to hang in a tower in this religious building in the Cantal region of southcentral France. It's a bizarre story that questions the relationship between the church, the rural world and the French administration.

title: Ten Parisian bistros where you can really relax
summary: You can enjoy home cooking and raise a glass with friends, in a warm atmosphere and at very reasonable prices. Here are 10 Paris bistros where you want to linger... and return!

title: The French companies betting on India: 'The India of today is the China of 20 years ago'
summary: Strong, sustainable growth, a gigantic mass of consumers, including a 100 million with strong purchasing power. The world's most populous country is increasingly attracting French entrepreneurs, large and small. But the market remains difficult to access, padlocked by monopolies.

title: Clint Eastwood's art of questioning the essence of the Hollywood hero
summary: In recent years, the American director's films have been inspired by real-life events, depicting the achievements of individuals, who are transformed into heroes by contemporary showmanship.

title: Portugal's shoe valley is moving upmarket
summary: In a deteriorating economic climate, Europe's second-largest footwear producer is counting on on the modernization of its industry and its expansion into luxury goods to withstand competition from Asia.

title: Shootout in western France leaves one teenager dead
summary: Five teenagers were hit by gunfire in Poitiers on Thursday evening. One of them, aged 15, was declared dead on Saturday morning. A suspect, believed to be involved in drug trafficking, is being sought by police.

title: In the last weekend on the campaign trail, Harris and Trump are zeroing in on Sunbelt states
summary: Kamala Harris also made an unscheduled stop in New York to appear in 'SNL.' A new survey in the 'Des Moines Register' shows the Democrat 3 points ahead of Donald Trump in Iowa, a state he won in 2016 and 2020.

title: India and China continue their disengagement in the Himalayas
summary: After the two countries signed an agreement on October 21 to re-establish patrols in Ladakh, troops have withdrawn from the disputed areas. But the cross-border conflict, far from over, also involves a third country: Bhutan.

title: 'Live from New York': Harris makes surprise 'SNL' appearance with election looming
summary: Vice President Kamala Harris briefly stepped away, Saturday, from the battleground states where she's been furiously campaigning in favor of the iconic sketch comedy show.

title: Bolivia's government accuses supporters of ex-President Evo Morales of taking 200 soldiers hostage
summary: The conflict broke out three weeks ago when Bolivian prosecutors launched an investigation into accusations that Morales fathered a child with a 15-year-old girl in 2016, classifying their relationship as statutory rape.

title: 'Songs of a Lost World,' The Cure's feverish, melancholy procession
summary: Sixteen years after their last record, Robert Smith's band is back with a strong 14th album tinged with mourning, nostalgia and elegant ardor.

title: France's Ugo Humbert pulls out all the stops to make it to the Paris Masters final
summary: The French tennis player is on a roll, defeating Russia's Karen Khachanov in Saturday's tense semi-final. In Sunday's final against Germany's Alexander Zverev, he will do everything he can to end France's 16-year drought at the Paris Masters.

title: COP16 on biodiversity ends without agreement on crucial issues
summary: While significant progress was made on the issues of genetic resources and indigenous peoples, negotiations failed to reach agreement on the major issue of financing.

title: Johnny Depp on a red carpet in Rome. Does anyone care?
summary: The American actor made a remarkable return to the red carpet at the Rome Film Festival on October 26, to present his second film as director, dedicated to the painter Amedeo Modigliani.

title: Defending abortion: A double-edged sword for the Democrats
summary: On the day of the presidential election, 10 states are also holding a referendum on access to abortion, a major theme of the campaign led by Kamala Harris, but one that isn't 'helping Democrats in the way that they would hope.'

title: Moldova goes to the polls for second round of presidential runoff amid fears of Russian interference
summary: Pro-EU incumbent Maia Sandu scored 42.5% of the vote in the first round of the presidential election two weeks ago. Her rival Alexandr Stoianoglo received 26%.

title: After Spain's deadly floods, the slow and difficult search for the missing
summary: After the severe floods that stunned south-eastern Spain, many people are still missing. To find the bodies, rescuers have to search through the cars swept away by the torrents of mud.

title: Zverev easily outplays Humbert to win Paris Masters
summary: The German player never faltered as he destroyed the hopes of the home favorite, Ugo Humbert, in two fast sets, 6-2, 6-2, in Paris's Accor Arena on Sunday.

title: Jerome Charyn: 'November 5 could very well mark America's last legitimate presidential election'
summary: In an op-ed, the American writer expresses his concern in the event of another victory for Donald Trump, who risks governing as if the US were a private company that he could destroy at will.

title: At Paris Photo, August Sander and his 600 portraits of Germans
summary: August Sander's 'People of the 20th Century' assembled over 600 portraits of his fellow German citizens taken between 1892 and 1954. This life's work, which remained unfinished, where the intimate blends with the sociological, is on show at Paris's Grand Palais, from November 7 to 10.

title: 'They put me in the trunk of the car': Drug traffickers are increasingly turning to kidnapping
summary: Ransoming is becoming more commonplace in France, including outside of big cities. At the heart of these operations are young people who compensate for their inexperience with a high level of violence.

title: When it comes to disinformation about the US presidential election, Elon Musk outdoes Russia
summary: Data collection, misleading ads, conspiracy theories: The richest man in the world is running an internet campaign in favor of Donald Trump using some particularly questionable methods.

title: 2024 US elections: The Latino vote has become more decisive than ever
summary: Now the largest ethnic minority group in the US, Latino voters have become a new heavyweight electorate, one which transcends partisan divides.

title: Angry flood survivors throw mud and insults at Spain's King Felipe
summary: The royal couple had to cut their visit to the town of Paiporta, where at least 200 people died, short after the locals pelted them with mud and called them 'murderers.' Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez had to be escorted away quickly.

title: Electoral College, winner-takes-all: How do the US elections actually work?
summary: There isn't just one American presidential election, there are 51: One for each state, plus the District of Columbia. Le Monde explains how this electoral system works.

title: The Netherland's Nageeye and Kenya's Chepkirui win New York Marathon
summary: More than 50,000 runners competed over the 26.2-mile journey across the city from Staten Island to the finish line in Central Park on Sunday.
